alert.note: Alert for East Cameron; Lafayette; Lower Vermilion; Northern Acadia; Northern Jefferson Davis; Southern Acadia; Southern Calcasieu; Southern Jefferson Davis; Upper Vermilion (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 08 at 7:26PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EASTERN CAMERON...LAFAYETTE... EASTERN JEFFERSON DAVIS...ACADIA...SOUTHEASTERN CALCASIEU AND VERMILION PARISHES THROUGH 830 PM CST... At 726 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Basile to near Gibbstown to 30 miles southeast of High Island. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lafayette, Crowley, Abbeville, Eunice, Jennings, Scott, Rayne, Carencro, Cameron, Kaplan, Church Point, Welsh, Lake Arthur, Basile, Iota, Gueydan, Mermentau, Rockefeller Wildlife Range, Freshwater City, and Hayes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 53 and 108. Interstate 49 between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CST for central, south central and southwestern Louisiana.
